content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Operation at (-15, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (position x=24.0, y=-15.0)
- Wooden chest for coal collection (position x=23.5, y=-16.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (position x=-14.0, y=23.0)
- Wooden chest for iron ore collection (position x=-14.5, y=21.5)

### Copper Mining and Smelting Complex at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill for copper ore (position x=20.0, y=20.0)
- Collection chest for copper ore (position x=20.5, y=21.5)
- Transfer chest for copper ore (position x=22.5, y=21.5)
- Stone furnace for smelting (position x=24.0, y=20.0)
- Output chest for copper plates (position x=24.5, y=17.5)
- Multiple burner inserters forming a transport chain:
  - Inserter at (x=21.5, y=21.5) moving items between chests
  - Inserter at (x=22.5, y=20.5) feeding the furnace
  - Inserter at (x=24.5, y=18.5) collecting finished plates
  - Support inserters at (x=20.5, y=22.5) and (x=22.5, y=22.5)

### Unused Smelting Setup
Two inactive stone furnaces at:
- Position (x=-11.0, y=20.0)
- Position (x=-9.0, y=20.0)

ERROR TIPS

### Fuel Management Errors
- Always ensure you have coal in your inventory before attempting to insert fuel into entities
- Check entity fuel levels regularly to prevent work stoppage

### Entity Configuration Issues
- When reconfiguring inserters, ensure both the pickup and drop positions are correctly set
- Verify inserter facing direction matches the intended material flow
- Make sure the entire production chain is properly connected and aligned

### Resource Flow Issues
- Monitor chest contents to prevent overflow or starvation
- Ensure proper connection between mining, storage, and processing facilities
- Set up adequate buffer storage between production stages
